Changes

Ver 1.05, 10 Nov 2013

Ignores any parameters which start with /sti. Windows adds two "/sti..." parameters if you run CmdTwain from the scanner button.

Ver 1.04, 28 Jul 2013

Added "/IN" "/CM" and "/WH w.w h.h" options.

Default install directory is now "C:\Program Files\GssEziSoft\CmdTwain".

Ver 1.03, 29 May 2013

The program runs in Win32 GUI mode again. This prevents an empty black window (Win32 console mode) appearing when the program runs.

Ver 1.02, 10 Feb 2013

This was an update to Ver 1.01 to get the DPI settings to "take". It involved a rewrite using MS Visual C++ 2010 and a more modern library (FreeImage). Earlier versions used Borland C++ and a very old version of the Intel JPEG library. CmdTwain now runs two subprograms.

The DPI setting is written to the file for both BMP and JPG formats.

"CmdTwain.exe /SOURCE" allows you to choose which TWAIN device to use.

The default install directory was "C:\Program Files\GssEziSoft\CmdTwain Free".

GssScan.bat is included.

Options are case insensitive.

Ver 1.01, 19 Jan 2013, NOT RELEASED

The DPI setting should have been written to the file for both BMP and JPG formats but the library used ignored the setting.

"CmdTwain.exe /SOURCE" allowed you to choose which TWAIN device to use.

As this was an update to Ver 0.03, options needed to be uppercase.

Ver 1.00, 27 May 2009, NOT RELEASED

This was an experimental version which was not released.

Options no longer needed to be specified in uppercase.

You could split the output path and filename into two separate parameters. This was useful for some programs.

The program supported quoted arguments. This is mainly useful for paths with spaces in them. e.g. "C:\Documents and Settings\...".

The GssScan.bat program was no longer needed (nor provided).

It supported autonumbering scans.

It included experimental support for document feeders. This feature was never tested.

Ver 0.03, 14 Jan 2009

This was supplied as an NSIS installer package. The default install directory was "C:\Program Files\Gss EziSoft\CmdTwain Free".

Ver 0.02, 19 Nov 2007

This was supplied as a ZIP file or as a self extracting archive. The self-extractor included an install.vbs file which simplified installation. Like its predecessor, it installed into "C:\Program Files\GssSoftware\CmdTwain" and included GssScan.bat in the "C:\Windows" directory.

Ver 0.01, 29 Sep 2007

This was a ZIP file. It installed into "C:\Program Files\GssSoftware\CmdTwain". It also provided GssScan.bat for the "C:\Windows" directory.
